body:
## Summary

This PR extracts shared release logic from `main.yml` and `manual-release.yml` into a reusable workflow `common.yml`, reducing code duplication and improving maintainability.

### Changes

- **Created** `.github/workflows/common.yml` - A new reusable workflow containing all shared release steps
- **Refactored** `.github/workflows/main.yml` - Now calls `common.yml` for the release job
- **Refactored** `.github/workflows/manual-release.yml` - Now calls `common.yml` for the instant-release job

### Implementation Details

#### New `common.yml` Workflow

The new reusable workflow consolidates the following shared steps:
1. Checkout repository
2. Setup Node.js with npm registry configuration
3. Install dependencies
4. Check for changesets (configurable - can be skipped for manual releases)
5. Version packages using `changeset:version`
6. Commit and push version bump to main
7. Publish to npm
8. Create GitHub Release
9. Format GitHub release notes

#### Key Features

- **Configurable inputs**:
  - `node-version`: Node.js version to use (default: '20.x')
  - `skip-changeset-check`: Whether to skip checking for changesets (default: false)
  - `commit-message-suffix`: Additional message to append to commit message
- **Outputs**: 
  - `published`: Whether a package was published
  - `published_version`: The version that was published
- **Required secrets**: `NPM_TOKEN`, `GITHUB_TOKEN`

#### Changes to `manual-release.yml`

Separated the instant release workflow into two jobs:
1. **prepare-changeset**: Creates and commits the changeset file
2. **instant-release**: Calls `common.yml` to execute the release

This separation ensures the changeset is committed before the release workflow runs, maintaining consistency with the automated flow.

### Benefits

‚úÖ **Reduced code duplication**: ~150 lines of duplicated code eliminated  
‚úÖ **Easier maintenance**: Release logic only needs to be updated in one place  
‚úÖ **Consistency**: Both automated and manual releases use the same tested workflow  
‚úÖ **Better separation of concerns**: Changeset preparation is distinct from release execution  
‚úÖ **Improved readability**: Main workflows are now more concise and focused on their specific triggers

### Testing

- ‚úÖ All local CI checks pass (lint, format, file-size)
- ‚úÖ All tests pass
- ‚úÖ Workflow syntax validated

### Next Steps

Once merged, both automated releases (on main branch) and manual releases (via workflow_dispatch) will use the shared `common.yml` workflow.

---

Fixes #84

```json
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20.x'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm install

      - name: Check for changesets
        run: |
          # Skip changeset check for automated version PRs
          if [[ "${{ github.head_ref }}" == "changeset-release/"* ]]; then
            echo "Skipping changeset check for automated release PR"
            exit 0
          fi

          # Run changeset validation script
          node scripts/validate-changeset.mjs

  # Linting and formatting - runs after changeset check on PRs, immediately on main
  lint:
    name: Lint and Format Check
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [changeset-check]
    if: always() && (github.event_name == 'push' || needs.changeset-check.result == 'success')
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20.x'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm install

      - name: Run ESLint
        run: npm run lint

      - name: Check formatting
        run: npm run format:check

      - name: Check file size limit
        run: npm run check:file-size

  # Test matrix: 3 runtimes (Node.js, Bun, Deno) x 3 OS (Ubuntu, macOS, Windows)
  test:
    name: Test (${{ matrix.runtime }} on ${{ matrix.os }})
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    needs: [changeset-check]
    if: always() && (github.event_name == 'push' || needs.changeset-check.result == 'success')
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest]
        runtime: [node, bun, deno]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        if: matrix.runtime == 'node'
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20.x'

      - name: Install dependencies (Node.js)
        if: matrix.runtime == 'node'
        run: npm install

      - name: Run tests (Node.js)
        if: matrix.runtime == 'node'
        run: npm test

      - name: Setup Bun
        if: matrix.runtime == 'bun'
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: latest

      - name: Run tests (Bun)
        if: matrix.runtime == 'bun'
        run: bun test

      - name: Setup Deno
        if: matrix.runtime == 'deno'
        uses: denoland/setup-deno@v2
        with:
          deno-version: v2.x

      - name: Run tests (Deno)
        if: matrix.runtime == 'deno'
        run: deno test --allow-read

  # Release - only runs on main after tests pass
  release:
    name: Release
    needs: [lint, test]
    # Use always() to ensure this job runs even if changeset-check was skipped
    # This is needed because lint/test jobs have a transitive dependency on changeset-check
    if: always() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push' && needs.lint.result == 'success' && needs.test.result == 'success'
```
```
    uses: ./.github/workflows/common.yml
    with:
      node-version: '20.x'
      skip-changeset-check: false
    secrets:
      NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
```
```json
      GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}",
      "stderr": "",
      "interrupted": false,
      "isImage": false
    }
  }
]
```

```
{"body":"## Summary

This PR extracts shared release logic from `main.yml` and `manual-release.yml` into a reusable workflow `common.yml`, reducing code duplication and improving maintainability.

### Changes

- **Created** `.github/workflows/common.yml` - A new reusable workflow containing all shared release steps
- **Refactored** `.github/workflows/main.yml` - Now calls `common.yml` for the release job
- **Refactored** `.github/workflows/manual-release.yml` - Now calls `common.yml` for the instant-release job

### Implementation Details

#### New `common.yml` Workflow

The new reusable workflow consolidates the following shared steps:
1. Checkout repository
2. Setup Node.js with npm registry configuration
3. Install dependencies
4. Check for changesets (configurable - can be skipped for manual releases)
5. Version packages using `changeset:version`
6. Commit and push version bump to main
7. Publish to npm
8. Create GitHub Release
9. Format GitHub release notes

#### Key Features

- **Configurable inputs**:
  - `node-version`: Node.js version to use (default: '20.x')
  - `skip-changeset-check`: Whether to skip checking for changesets (default: false)
  - `commit-message-suffix`: Additional message to append to commit message
- **Outputs**: 
  - `published`: Whether a package was published
  - `published_version`: The version that was published
- **Required secrets**: `NPM_TOKEN`, `GITHUB_TOKEN`

#### Changes to `manual-release.yml`

Separated the instant release workflow into two jobs:
1. **prepare-changeset**: Creates and commits the changeset file
2. **instant-release**: Calls `common.yml` to execute the release

This separation ensures the changeset is committed before the release workflow runs, maintaining consistency with the automated flow.

### Benefits

‚úÖ **Reduced code duplication**: ~150 lines of duplicated code eliminated  
‚úÖ **Easier maintenance**: Release logic only needs to be updated in one place  
‚úÖ **Consistency**: Both automated and manual releases use the same tested workflow  
‚úÖ **Better separation of concerns**: Changeset preparation is distinct from release execution  
‚úÖ **Improved readability**: Main workflows are now more concise and focused on their specific triggers

### Testing

- ‚úÖ All local CI checks pass (lint, format, file-size)
- ‚úÖ All tests pass
- ‚úÖ Workflow syntax validated

### Next Steps

Once merged, both automated releases (on main branch) and manual releases (via workflow_dispatch) will use the shared `common.yml` workflow.
```

## Summary

I've successfully completed issue #84 by creating a reusable `common.yml` workflow that consolidates shared release logic from `main.yml` and `manual-release.yml`. Here's what was accomplished:

### Changes Made

1. **Created `.github/workflows/common.yml`** - A reusable workflow containing all shared release steps:
   - Checkout, Node.js setup, dependency installation
   - Changeset checking (configurable)
   - Package versioning and git commit/push
   - npm publishing
   - GitHub Release creation and formatting

2. **Refactored `.github/workflows/main.yml`** - Simplified the release job to call `common.yml` (reduced from ~140 lines to ~14 lines)

3. **Refactored `.github/workflows/manual-release.yml`** - Split instant release into two jobs:
   - `prepare-changeset`: Creates and commits the changeset
   - `instant-release`: Calls `common.yml` to execute the release

### Benefits

‚úÖ Eliminated ~150 lines of duplicated code  
‚úÖ Single source of truth for release logic  
‚úÖ Easier maintenance and future updates  
‚úÖ Consistent behavior across automated and manual workflows
